intro: Ficaria verna f. incumbens, commonly known as the snowdrop, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the genus Ficaria within the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other spring-flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, nodding white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped leaves that emerge from a basal rosette. The snowdrop is adapted to grow in woodland areas and is often found in shaded, moist environments.
